SEARCH
Module com.github.sttk.stringcase
Package com.github.sttk.stringcase

Class StringCase

java.lang.Object
com.github.sttk.stringcase.StringCase
public final class StringCase extends Object
StringCase is the class that provides the static methods to convert a string to various cases.

  • Method Details

    • camelCase

      public static String camelCase(String input)
      Converts a string to camel case. This method takes a string as its arguments, then returns a string of which the case style is camel case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and all characters except ASCII alphabets and ASCII numbers are eliminated as word separators. 
      
     String camel = StringCase.camelCase("foo_bar_baz");
     // => "fooBarBaz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      Returns:
      A string converted to camel case.

    • camelCaseWithSep

      public static String camelCaseWithSep(String input, String seps)
      Converts a string to camel case using the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is camel case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters specified as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are eliminated. 
      
     String camel = StringCase.camelCaseWithSep("foo-bar100%baz", "- ");
     // => "fooBar100%Baz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      seps - A string that consists of characters that are word separators.
      Returns:
      A string converted to camel case.

    • camelCaseWithKeep

      public static String camelCaseWithKeep(String input, String keeped)
      Converts a string to camel case using characters other than the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is camel case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters other than the specified characters as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are eliminated. 
      
     String camel = StringCase.camelCaseWithKeep("foo-bar100%baz", "%");
     // => "fooBar100%Baz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      keeped - A string that consists of characters that are not word separators.
      Returns:
      A string converted to camel case.

    • cobolCase

      public static String cobolCase(String input)
      Converts a string to cobol case. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is cobol case. This method targets the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and all characters except ASCII alphabets and ASCII numbers are replaced to hyphens as word separators. 
      
     String cobol = StringCase.cobolCase("foo_bar_baz");
     // => "FOO-BAR-BAZ"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      Returns:
      A string converted to cobol case.

    • cobolCaseWithSep

      public static String cobolCaseWithSep(String input, String seps)
      Converts a string to cobol case using the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is cobol case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters specified as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are replaced to hyphens. 
      
     String cobol = StringCase.cobolCaseWithSep("foo-bar100%baz", "- ");
     // => "FOO-BAR100%-BAZ"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      seps - A string that consists of characters that are word separators.
      Returns:
      A string converted to cobol case.

    • cobolCaseWithKeep

      public static String cobolCaseWithKeep(String input, String keeped)
      Converts a string to cobol case using characters other than the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is cobol case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters other than the specified characters as the second argument of this method are regard as word separators and are replaced to hyphens. 
      
     String cobol = StringCase.cobolCaseWithKeep("foo-bar100%baz", "%");
     // => "FOO-BAR100%-BAZ"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      keeped - A string that consists of characters that are not word separators.
      Returns:
      A string converted to cobol case.

    • kebabCase

      public static String kebabCase(String input)
      Converts a string to kebab case. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is kebab case. This method targets the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and all characters except ASCII alphabets and ASCII numbers are eliminated as word separators. 
      
     String kebab = StringCase.kebabCase("fooBarBaz");
     // => "foo-bar-baz;
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      Returns:
      A string converted to kebab case.

    • kebabCaseWithSep

      public static String kebabCaseWithSep(String input, String seps)
      Converts a string to kebab case using the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is kebab case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters specified as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are replaced to hyphens. 
      
     String kebab = StringCase.kebabCaseWithSep("foo-Bar100%Baz", "- ");
     // => "foo-bar100%-baz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      seps - A string that consists of characters that are word separators.
      Returns:
      A string converted to kebab case.

      public static String kebabCaseWithKeep(String input, String keeped)
      Converts a string to kebab case using characters other than the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is kebab case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters other than the specified characters as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are replaced to hyphens.

    • macroCase

      public static String macroCase(String input)
      Converts a string to macro case. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is macro case. This method targets the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and all characters except ASCII alphabets and ASCII numbers are eliminated as word separators. 
      
     String macro = StringCase.macroCase("fooBarBaz");
     // => "FOO_BAR_BAZ"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      Returns:
      A string converted to macro case.

    • macroCaseWithSep

      public static String macroCaseWithSep(String input, String seps)
      Converts a string to macro case using the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is macro case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters specified as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are replaced to underscores. 
      
     String macro = StringCase.macroCaseWithSep("foo-Bar100%Baz", "- ");
     // => "FOO_BAR100%_BAZ"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      seps - A string that consists of characters that are word separators.
      Returns:
      A string converted to macro case.

    • macroCaseWithKeep

      public static String macroCaseWithKeep(String input, String keeped)
      Converts a string to macro case using characters other than the specified characters as separators. This mthod takes a string slice as its argument, then returns a `String` of which the case style is macro case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters other than the specified characters as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are replaced to underscores. 
      
     String macro = StringCase.macroCaseWithKeep("foo-bar100%baz", "%");
     // => "FOO_BAR100%_BAZ;
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      keeped - A string that consists of characters that are not word separators.
      Returns:
      A string converted to macro case.

    • pascalCase

      public static String pascalCase(String input)
      Converts a string to pascal case. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is pascal case. This method targets the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and all characters except ASCII alphabets and ASCII numbers are eliminated as word separators. 
      
     String pascal = StringCase.pascalCase("foo_bar_baz");
     // => "FooBarBaz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      Returns:
      A string converted to pascal case.

    • pascalCaseWithSep

      public static String pascalCaseWithSep(String input, String seps)
      Converts a string to pascal case using the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is pascal case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters specified as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are eliminated. 
      
     String pascal = StringCase.pascalCaseWithSep("foo-Bar100%Baz", "- ");
     // => "FooBar100%Baz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      seps - A string that consists of characters that are word separators.
      Returns:
      A string converted to pascal case.

    • pascalCaseWithKeep

      public static String pascalCaseWithKeep(String input, String keeped)
      Converts a string to pascal case using characters other than the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is pascal case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters other than the specified characters as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are eliminated. 
      
     String pascal = StringCase.pascalCaseWithKeep("foo-bar100%baz", "%");
     // => "FooBar100%Baz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.

      A string converted to pascal case.

    • snakeCase

      public static String snakeCase(String input)
      Converts a string to snake case. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is snake case. This method targets the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and all characters except ASCII alphabets and ASCII numbers are eliminated as word separators. 
      
     String snake = StringCase.snakeCase("fooBarBaz");
     // => "foo_bar_baz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      Returns:
      A string converted to snake case.

    • snakeCaseWithSep

      public static String snakeCaseWithSep(String input, String seps)
      Converts a string to snake case using the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a strin` of which the case style is snake case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters specified as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are replaced to underscores. 
      
     String snake = StringCase.snakeCaseWithSep("foo-Bar100%Baz", "- ");
     // => "foo_bar100%_baz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      seps - A string that consists of characters that are word separators.
      Returns:
      A string converted to snake case.

    • snakeCaseWithKeep

      public static String snakeCaseWithKeep(String input, String keeped)
      Converts a string to snake case using characters other than the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is snake case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters other than the specified characters as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are replaced to underscores. 
      
     let snake = stringcase::snake_case_with_keep("foo-bar100%baz", "%");
     // => "foo_bar100%_baz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      keeped - A string that consists of characters that are not word separators.
      Returns:
      A string converted to snake case.

    • trainCase

      public static String trainCase(String input)
      Converts a string to train case. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is train case. This method targets the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and all characters except ASCII alphabets and ASCII numbers are eliminated as word separators. 
      
     String train = StringCase.trainCase("fooBarBaz");
     // => "Foo-Bar-Baz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      Returns:
      A string converted to train case.

    • trainCaseWithSep

      public static String trainCaseWithSep(String input, String seps)
      Converts a string to train case using the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is train case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters specified as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are replaced to hyphens. 
      
     String train = StringCase.trainCaseWithSep("foo-Bar100%Baz", "- ");
     // => "Foo-Bar100%-Baz"
      Parameters:
      input - A string to be converted.
      seps - A string that consists of characters that are word separators.
      Returns:
      A string converted to train case.

    • trainCaseWithKeep

      public static String trainCaseWithKeep(String input, String keeped)
      Converts a string to train case using characters other than the specified characters as separators. This method takes a string as its argument, then returns a string of which the case style is train case. This method targets only the upper and lower cases of ASCII alphabets for capitalization, and the characters other than the specified characters as the second argument of this method are regarded as word separators and are replaced to hyphens. 
      
     String train = StringCase.trainCaseWithKeep("foo-bar100%baz", "%");
     // => "Foo-Bar100%-Baz"
